db:abstract.db:para: Menu popup that can be used as a context menu or popup menu.
This type was introduced in Qt 5.7.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Menu has two main use cases:

db:listitem.db:para: Context menus; for example, a menu that is shown after right clicking
Popup menus; for example, a menu that is shown after clicking a button

db:section.db:para: When used as a context menu, the recommended way of opening the menu is to call popup(). Unless a position is explicitly specified, the menu is positioned at the mouse cursor on desktop platforms that have a mouse cursor available, and otherwise centered over its parent item.
When used as a popup menu, it is easiest to specify the position by specifying the desired x and y coordinates using the respective properties, and call open() to open the menu.
Since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10), it is also possible to create sub-menus and declare Action objects inside Menu:
Sub-menus are cascading by default on desktop platforms that have a mouse cursor available. Non-cascading menus are shown one menu at a time, and centered over the parent menu.

Typically, menu items are statically declared as children of the menu, but Menu also provides API to add, insert, move and remove items dynamically. The items in a menu can be accessed using itemAt() or contentChildren.
Although MenuItems are most commonly used with Menu, it can contain any type of item.

db:section.db:title: Margins
db:section.db:para: As it is inherited from Popup, Menu supports margins. By default, all of the built-in styles specify 0 for Menu's margins to ensure that the menu is kept within the bounds of the window. To allow a menu to go outside of the window (to animate it moving into view, for example), set the margins property to -1.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] cascade : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the menu cascades its sub-menus.

The default value is platform-specific. Menus are cascading by default on desktop platforms that have a mouse cursor available. Non-cascading menus are shown one menu at a time, and centered over the parent menu.

db:note.db:para: Changing the value of the property has no effect while the menu is open.

db:section.db:para: This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: contentData : list<Object>
db:section.db:para: This property holds the list of content data.

The list contains all objects that have been declared in QML as children of the menu, and also items that have been dynamically added or inserted using the addItem() and insertItem() methods, respectively.

db:note.db:para: Unlike contentChildren, contentData does include non-visual QML objects. It is not re-ordered when items are inserted or moved.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] contentModel : model
db:section.db:para: This property holds the model used to display menu items.
The content model is provided for visualization purposes. It can be assigned as a model to a content item that presents the contents of the menu.
The model allows menu items to be statically declared as children of the menu.

db:section.db:title: [read-only, since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] count : int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the number of items.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] currentIndex : int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the index of the currently highlighted item.
Menu items can be highlighted by mouse hover or keyboard navigation.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] delegate : Component
db:section.db:para: This property holds the component that is used to create items to present actions.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: focus : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the popup wants focus.
When the popup actually receives focus, activeFocus will be true. For more information, see Keyboard Focus in Qt Quick.
The default value is false.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] overlap : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the amount of pixels by which the menu horizontally overlaps its parent menu.
The property only has effect when the menu is used as a cascading sub-menu.
The default value is style-specific.

db:note.db:para: Changing the value of the property has no effect while the menu is open.

db:section.db:para: This property was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: title : string
db:section.db:para: This property holds the title for the menu.
The title of a menu is often displayed in the text of a menu item when the menu is a submenu, and in the text of a tool button when it is in a menubar.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void popup(Item parent, MenuItem item = null)
db:section.db:para: Opens the menu at the mouse cursor on desktop platforms that have a mouse cursor available, and otherwise centers the menu over its parent item.
The menu can be optionally aligned to a specific menu item.
This QML method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void popup(Item parent, point pos, MenuItem item = null)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: void popup(Item parent, point pos, MenuItem item)

db:section.db:bridgehead: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void popup(point pos, MenuItem item = null)
db:section.db:para: Opens the menu at the specified position pos in the popups coordinate system, that is, a coordinate relative to its parent item.
The menu can be optionally aligned to a specific menu item.
This QML method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void popup(Item parent, real x, real y, MenuItem item = null)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: void popup(Item parent, real x, real y, MenuItem item)

db:section.db:bridgehead: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void popup(real x, real y, MenuItem item = null)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: void popup(real x, real y, MenuItem item)

db:section.db:para: Opens the menu at the specified position x, y in the popups coordinate system, that is, a coordinate relative to its parent item.
The menu can be optionally aligned to a specific menu item.
This QML method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] Action actionAt(int index)
db:section.db:para: Returns the action at index, or null if the index is not valid or there is no action at the specified index.
This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void addAction(Action action)
db:section.db:para: Adds action to the end of this menu.
This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: void addItem(Item item)
db:section.db:para: Adds item to the end of the list of items.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void addMenu(Menu menu)
db:section.db:para: Adds menu as a sub-menu to the end of this menu.
This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void dismiss()
db:section.db:para: Closes all menus in the hierarchy that this menu belongs to.

db:note.db:para: Unlike close() that only closes a menu and its sub-menus, dismiss() closes the whole hierarchy of menus, including the parent menus. In practice, close() is suitable e.g. for implementing navigation in a hierarchy of menus, and dismiss() is the appropriate method for closing the whole hierarchy of menus.

db:section.db:para: This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void insertAction(int index, Action action)
db:section.db:para: Inserts action at index. The index is within all items in the menu.
This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: void insertItem(int index, Item item)
db:section.db:para: Inserts item at index.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void insertMenu(int index, Menu menu)
db:section.db:para: Inserts menu as a sub-menu at index. The index is within all items in the menu.
This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: Item itemAt(int index)
db:section.db:para: Returns the item at index, or null if it does not exist.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] Menu menuAt(int index)
db:section.db:para: Returns the sub-menu at index, or null if the index is not valid or there is no sub-menu at the specified index.
This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: void moveItem(int from, int to)
db:section.db:para: Moves an item from one index to another.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void removeAction(Action action)
db:section.db:para: Removes and destroys the specified action.
This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void removeItem(Item item)
db:section.db:para: Removes and destroys the specified item.
This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] void removeMenu(Menu menu)
db:section.db:para: Removes and destroys the specified menu.
This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] Action takeAction(int index)
db:section.db:para: Removes and returns the action at index. The index is within all items in the menu.

db:note.db:para: The ownership of the action is transferred to the caller.

db:section.db:para: This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] MenuItem takeItem(int index)
db:section.db:para: Removes and returns the item at index.

db:note.db:para: The ownership of the item is transferred to the caller.

db:section.db:para: This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10)] Menu takeMenu(int index)
db:section.db:para: Removes and returns the menu at index. The index is within all items in the menu.

db:note.db:para: The ownership of the menu is transferred to the caller.

db:section.db:para: This method was introduced in QtQuick.Controls 2.3 (Qt 5.10).
